intro: Atropis tenella, commonly known as the narrowleaf nightshade, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Solanaceae family, which includes other well-known plants like tomatoes and potatoes. The plant is characterized by its narrow, elongated leaves and small, violet-colored flowers that bloom in spring. It produces berries that are toxic to humans and animals, containing alkaloids such as atropine. Due to its toxicity, it is often considered a weed in agricultural settings.
